This species is considered aerobic, meaning it requires oxygen for growth, and is catalase-positive and oxidase-positive. It can grow at temperatures ranging from 4°C to 37°C, with an optimal growth temperature around 25-30°C.

Chryseobacterium nakagawai has been found in various environmental sources, including soil, water, and plant materials. Its potential ecological roles and potential applications in biotechnology or environmental remediation are still under investigation.
